cluster_relations.rel_desc: The essay on body language focuses on body language as its main topic.
The essay will cover the different types of body language.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a document, text, or discourse takes the object as its main topic or subject matter.
args.justification: Both relations link an essay to the topic it covers, with rel_hint_type='aboutness' and descriptions indicating topical focus. They share identical aboutness semantics, so a single canonical predicate 'is_about' is appropriate.
args.remark: Use this predicate for document/topic or discourse/topic relationships.

args.justification: Both relations represent a topical linkage where a text is about a concept (body language, types of body language). This fits a general aboutness_relation class that can cover various canonical predicates like is_about, discusses, or covers.
Aboutness expresses a semantic association between a document and its topic rather than composition, causality, or hierarchy. The broad category 'ASSOCIATION' best captures this topical linkage.
